description: All required supporting documentation and bid submission must be submitted by January 17, 2022 by 12:00 PM MST. All bids submitted after 12:00 PM MST will result in the bid being declared non-responsive. Correctional Service Canada (CSC) has a requirement to upgrade the electrical infrastructure at the Bowden Institution in Bowden, Alberta. The contractor should complete the work within 65 weeks from the date of notification of acceptance of the offer. This posting is the second phase (Phase Two) will invite the qualified suppliers to provide a financial bid on the project based on the specifications and drawings.
full_summary:
===================

### Electronic Document (Punch-List) Notice

#### Phase 2 Invitation to Tender for Electrical Upgrades at the CSC Bowden Institution

**Document Reference**: WS3749947555

**Publication Date**: December 12, 2022

**Closing Date**: January 24, 2023, at 14:00:00 MST

**Procurement Category**: Construction and Infrastructure (CNST)

**Notice Type**: Directed Contract

**Procurement Method**: Competitive, Selective Tendering (Appel d'offres sélectif)

**Subject**: Invitation to Tender for the Electrical Upgrade Project at the CSC Bowden Institution

**Contracting Entity Information**:

* Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* Address: 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, Quebec, K1A 0S5, Canada

**End User Entity Information**:

* Correctional Service of Canada (CSC)
* Address: 340 Laurier Ave W, Ottawa, Ontario, K1P 0P9, Canada

**Tender Description**: This is the second phase (Phase Two) of the invitation to tender for the electrical upgrade project at the CSC Bowden Institution. The contractor will be responsible for upgrading the electrical infrastructure and completing the work within 65 weeks from the date of notification of acceptance of the offer.

**Bid Requirements**:

* All supporting documentation and bid submissions must be received by January 17, 2022, at 12:00 PM MST.
* Bids submitted after the specified deadline will be declared non-responsive.

**Trade Agreements**: The procurement is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

**	hsPC Info Contact Info**:

* Matthew Virakorn, SPAC/PSPC
* Email: [matthew.virakorn@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:matthew.virakorn@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

_If you require further information or clarification, please contact the contracting authority._
